subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Melissa Virus: Email's First Pandemic
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Melissa Virus: Email's First Pandemic usable.

hook.text: In 1999, an email with the subject 'Important Message' brought Microsoft and Intel to their knees.

buildup.text: The Melissa virus spread via Word macros. It emailed itself to 50 contacts from every infected machine.

discovery.text: Within hours it overwhelmed email servers worldwide. Companies had to shut down their email entirely.

twist.text: Creator David Smith was caught because he tested the virus using his own AOL account. Digital fingerprints.

climax.text: Melissa caused $80 million in damage and showed that email was a weapon, not just a tool.

punchline.text: The first email pandemic spread faster than any flu.
